findings.title: Potential use of "block.number" as source of randomness (SWC-120)
findings.description: Using block.number as a source of randomness is insecure because it can be manipulated by miners.

findings.title: Owner can set buy/sell fees up to 25%
findings.description: The owner of the contract has the ability to set buy and sell fees up to 25%, which could potentially lead to unfair or exploitative practices.

findings.title: Owner can burn tokens
findings.description: The owner of the contract has the ability to burn tokens, which could lead to unintended consequences or malicious behavior.

findings.title: Owner can mint tokens
findings.description: The owner has the capability to mint new tokens, which could lead to potential security risks and unintended consequences.

findings.title: Owner can block user
findings.description: The owner has the capability to block a user.

findings.title: Owner can set max wallet amount not lower than 1% of total supply
findings.description: The owner has the capability to set the maximum wallet amount to a value not less than 1% of the total token supply, which may lead to potential security risks.
